articles.description: MONTEZUMA, Iowa (AP) — Iowa official says suspect in custody in Mollie Tibbetts' death being held on federal immigration detainer.

articles.description: TUCSON, Ariz. (AP) — Border Patrol authorities say 128 immigrants believed abandoned by smugglers at the southern Arizona border are facing deportation.

articles.title: 5 faith leaders arrested in immigration protest at prison
articles.description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio (AP) — Five clergy members protesting the detention of immigrants at a prison in Ohio have been arrested on trespassing charges.

articles.title: Murder charge filed in fatal Shakopee stabbing
articles.description: SHAKOPEE, Minn. (AP) — A man has been charged with fatally stabbing a woman in Shakopee in what authorities describe as domestic violence.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Other suspected Nazi war criminals removed from the US
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Since the 1970s, the U.S. government has initiated legal proceedings to expel just 137 of the estimated 10,000 suspected Nazi war criminals who immigrated to the U.S. after World War II.

articles.title: Video: Trump praises border patrol agent who 'speaks perfect English'
articles.description: At a White House event meant to honor immigration officials, President Trump praised one border patrol agent in particular, saying he 'saved 78 people' and 'speaks perfect English.'

articles.title: House GOP’s Midterm Campaign Chief Urges Unlimited College-Grad Immigration
articles.description: The legislator responsible for keeping the GOP's House majority in November says companies should be allowed to hire an unlimited number of foreign university-graduates in place of Americans.

articles.title: Watch: Trump Refocuses Midterm Elections on Immigration, ‘Blue Wave Means Crime, Open Borders’
articles.description: President Trump is refocusing the midterm elections on the issue of immigration, saying in a White House speech on Monday that a "blue wave" in November "means crime" and "open borders."
